Truong Sa Island This is a gift of gratitude
that the mainland sent to the remote islands of the
country on the occasion of the
traditional Tet, overcoming more than 300 nautical miles. Cao HQ
571 was able to reach the island commune of the Tu Tay River despite
big waves and rough seas.  The remaining Tet goods

as well as the agencies and organizations
received spiritual
and material gifts and there was a lot of joy.
People here have also prepared for
Tet celebration.  The gifts sent to

mainland, adding a branch of apricot blossoms, a little banh luan, a pot of

spring has begun in Truong Sa, the
working group also organized many

Although Tet here still has many

Yesterday, Da Nang city police

3,500 boxes.  containing all kinds of dairy products that are

Korea's 2023 Kim Chi export price
has set a new record. This result
is due to the spread of
Korean entertainment content, in which kimchi
is a cultural symbol of the
Northeast
Asian country.  General data released on January 21
by the Korea Customs Service showed that the
total amount of kimchi exported in 2023
reached more than 44,000 tons, an increase of 7.1 minutes compared to the
record level of 42,000 tons set in
2021 compared to  Last year, the export value
of kimchi increased by 10.5 minutes reaching 155.6 million
US dollars. Japan is the partner importing the
most Kimchi from Korea with more than
20,000 tons, followed by the US and the Netherlands who
imported the most Kimchi.  respectively more than 10,000 tons and
nearly 2000 tons while Korea also
imported Kim Chi mainly from China
due to lower production costs compared to the
domestic market. Last year,
Korea's kimchi imports reached more than
163 million USD, down 3.4 minutes compared to the same
period last year. The country aims to
bring Kim Chi export turnover to 300
million USD by
2027. With a series of stable production plans,

automatic positioning power supply and
communication systems.  The
satellite's control and processing are all working well.
